# Causal Inference Reading List (mostly books):

(Asterisks indicated “must reads”!)

## Introductory Books:

1)	*Hernán MA, Robins JM (2020). Causal Inference: What If. Boca Raton: Chapman & Hall/CRC. 

One of the most clearly written and comprehensive treatments of modern causal inference. A must read!

2)	Cunningham (2021) Causal Inference: The Mixtape

Very clearly written, with a focus / context in econometrics

4) Pearl, Glymour, Jewell (2016) Causal Inference in Statistics: A Primer

5) Imbens and Rubin (2015) Causal Inference for Statistics, Social, and Biomedical Sciences

6) VanderWeele (2015) Explanation in Causal Inference: Methods for Mediation and Interaction

One of the best texts on methods for mediation analysis

## Advanced Texts

1)	Pearl (2009) Causality: Models, Reasoning, and Inference

2) van der Laan and Rose (2011) Targeted Learning: Causal Inference for Observational and Experimental Data.

## Other

3) Aronow and Miller (2019) Foundations of Agnostic Statistics. 

Intermediate/advanced text on statistics. Chapter 7 is an excellent treatment of causal inference.
